tourBios.exmtStatus: Top 16, 1999 SENIOR PGA TOUR National Qualifying Tournament
tourBios.carHigh: 1998: Medalist at the California regional qualifier to make it to the SENIOR TOUR National Qualifying Tournament at Grenelefe...Missed the 36-hole cut, however, with a score of six-over-par 150.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Played the PGA TOUR in 1973 and had his best finish in Mississippi at the Magnolia Classic with a T19 in the event with a final-round 67...Also was third in the Lake Michigan Classic that year, an unofficial event on the circuit that season...Lost his card, but played for another seven years professionally before regaining his amateur status in 1982...Worked in sales and was a sales manager for Sunkist in California, until the fall of 1998...Decided to return to professional golf again when he became 50...Has had four holes-in-one in competition.
tourBios.personal: All-League in football, basketball and golf in high school...All-League in football in junior college and a College Division All-America selection at Cal Poly-San Luis Obispo...Comes from a golfing family where both parents were single-digit handicappers...Biggest thrill in golf was standing on the 18th tee at the Old Course in St. Andrews with the sun setting...Lists Arnold Palmer as his biggest hero and his wife as the most influential person in his career.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Champions was T35th in 2000 at the Cadillac NFL Golf Classic.
